item.title: EA Sports College Football 25 Updates Its Player Ratings
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • EA Sports College Football 25 updates a number of player ratings to reflect real-life performance accurately.
  • Updated players include Travis Hunter, Nico Iamaleava, Cam Ward, and more.
  • EA continues to provide College Football 25 with regular updates and support to ensure the game's ongoing success.

EA Sports College Football 25 has made updates to the player ratings for five athletes, keeping up with the constantly changing world of college football. These EA Sports College Football 25 updates are meant to better capture the abilities and performances of these top players by focusing on important skills like accuracy, blocking, and sack-breaking abilities.

EA Sports College Football 25 brought college football gaming back with some exciting new features. The CampusIQ system changes player ratings based on how they perform in real life, while the College Football 25 Wear & Tear system adds realism by simulating player fatigue and injuries over the season. With over 130 teams and real player likenesses, the game also includes popular modes like Dynasty Mode and Road to Glory. These features have made EA Sports College Football 25 a major player in sports gaming for 2024, but the developer isn’t stopping there. EA continues to keep the game updated to ensure it stays relevant.

Among the changes made to player ratings in EA Sports College Football 25 is Cam Ward from the University of Miami, who saw his overall rating go up to 91, a +2 increase. His ability to throw on the run is now a 97, with a +6 boost, and his break sack skill also improved by +6, bringing it to 95. Jihaad Campbell, a middle linebacker from the University of Alabama, had a big upgrade with a +4 jump, raising his overall rating to 89. His block shedding went up by +5, now at 85, and his impact blocking had a huge increase of +17, reaching 87.

EA Sports College Football 25 Updates Ratings for Five Athletes

  • Cam Ward - University of Miami
  • Jihaad Campbell - University of Alabama
  • Nico Iamaleava - University of Tennessee
  • Travis Hunter - University of Colorado
  • Ashton Jeanty - Boise State University

Additionally, quarterback Nico Iamaleava from the University of Tennessee had his overall rating boosted by +2, making him an 88-rated player. His deep throw accuracy improved to 87, and his break sack ability saw a huge jump, now at 88 after a +14 boost. Travis Hunter, a College Football 25 wide receiver and cornerback from the University of Colorado, saw his overall rating increase to 97, a +2 boost. His catch-in-traffic skill is now at 93, with a +6 increase, while his hit power jumped by +10 to 77. Boise State’s halfback, Ashton Jeanty, now has a 96 overall rating, up by +4. His carrying ability increased by +6, bringing it to 84, and his speed went up by +2, now at 93.

In addition to updating player ratings, EA Sports College Football 25 keeps improving with regular updates aimed at making the game feel more realistic and authentic. After its release in July 2024, it quickly became the best-selling title of the year in the U.S. With continued updates and support, EA is ensuring that the game remains a success.

item.title: 15 Most Realistic Looking Players In EA FC 25, Ranked
item.description:
With each new iteration of EA FC (ever since it was called FIFA ), the gameplay mechanics continue to evolve and transform. Whether it's refined ball physics or more tactical depth, the boundaries of realism continue to be stretched. However, it's not just the gameplay that EA focuses on, as the graphics have also seen some remarkable improvements over the years.

Considering that EA Sports FC 25 boasts a plethora of superstars, it's no surprise that EA would want them looking as close to photo-realistic as possible. Player models continue to become more detailed, as each rendition of the title enhances the authenticity of the visuals. With such realistic graphics and fluid gameplay, the in-game immersion is at an all-time high.

15 Cristiano Ronaldo

Al-Nassr FC

  • Position: ST
  • Rating: 86

Despite now playing in the Saudi Pro League, Cristiano Ronaldo remains one of the most recognizable people on the planet, and he's been the poster boy for countless FIFAs in the past. It's no shock then that EA ensured his player model captured his likeness with incredible precision.

The attention to detail extends past his sharp facial features and iconic hairstyle, as the designers managed to capture his presence on the pitch too. If any FC 25 players play against a team with Ronaldo in it, they'll immediately recognize him as easily on the virtual pitch as they would in reality.

14 Declan Rice

Arsenal FC

  • Position: CDM/CM
  • Rating: 87

One of Arsenal's most expensive ever signings, Declan Rice is widely regarded as one of the best defensive midfielders in the Premier League, and perhaps even the world. A player of that caliber must've been high on EA's priority list to render well, and it's fair to say that they succeeded.

Rice's signature look, including his intense focus and serious expressions during matches, have all been captured. He's the standout of the Arsenal team when it comes to realistic renders, and his dominant presence on the pitch is there to match.

13 N'Golo Kanté

Al-Ittihad FC

  • Position: CDM/CM
  • Rating: 85

It's clear that the Saudi Pro League aims to be one of the most competitive leagues in the world, and they've been acquiring a lot of elite footballers to match their ambition. Thus, with such a large group of recognizable talent, it makes sense that EA put such effort into rendering their models so accurately, with N'Golo Kanté being one of the standouts.

After almost a decade in the Premier League and a wealth of trophies to show for his time there, Kante became known for his wide smile and tireless work ethic. EA's designers have managed to capture what made him stand out as a player incredibly well, as his clean-cut appearance reflects the humble and hardworking persona he became known for.

12 Antoine Griezmann

Atlético Madrid

  • Position: ST
  • Rating: 88

The French forward has rocked a variety of hairstyles across the years, and EA's always made an effort to capture their likeness in his virtual rendition. In the latest entry to the franchise, Griezmann has ditched the bleached blonde and curls, but he still remains as recognizable as ever.

From his wavy hair to his neatly trimmed beard, the striker stands out among his Atlético teammates. Players won't need his iconic celebrations to spot him on the pitch, that's for sure.

11 Jeremie Frimpong

Bayer Leverkusen

  • Position: RM/RB/RW
  • Rating: 84

Leverkusen shocked the world in the 23/24 season when they ran away with the Bundesliga title undefeated, toppling a dynasty that Bayern Munich had ruled for the past decade. One of the team's most important players to their success was Jeremie Frimpong, and he's arguably as invaluable in the game too.

His development to being one of the best right-backs in the world was clearly worthy of some special treatment by EA, as his facial rendering is fantastic. His distinctive appearance and coiled hair make him one of the more notable players for Bayer Leverkusen, and his in-game look matches that with ease.

10 Sadio Mané

Al Nassr FC

  • Position: LM/RM/ST/LW
  • Rating: 84

Sadio Mané will always be remembered as an influential player and crucial to Liverpool's success under manager Jürgen Klopp, but now he plays alongside Cristiano Ronaldo at Al Nassr FC in Saudi Arabia.

He finds himself in some high-profile company, and EA gave him just as good a graphical treatment as the other superstars there received. His sharp cheekbones and closely cut hair are rendered excellently, and he looks the best he has yet.

9 Son Heung-Min

Tottenham Hotspur FC

  • Position: ST/LM
  • Rating: 87

There's a strong argument to be made that Son Heung-Min is the best Asian player to ever grace world football, with his fame and status preceding him. He's a Korean icon and is regularly featured in EA Sports FC marketing material, so his resemblance in-game has to be strong to match that.

Well, he's clearly the focal point of marketing for a reason, as his model looks stunningly realistic, especially in motion on the pitch. When Sonny scores and pulls out his iconic picture celebration, it's as if players are watching him live in the Premier League.

8 Jules Koundé

FC Barcelona

  • Position: RB/CB
  • Rating: 85

Barcelona have been incredibly trusting in their youth for the past few seasons, and one player who's grown to be one of the more constant and reliable members of the team is Jules Koundé. His versatility across the back line, alongside his speed and defending, make him a great pick for any player.

He doesn't just bring a touch of class to the team though, as his player model helps increase the immersion for anyone using him in-game. Considering he plays among some popular young stars, his photo-realistic likeness might go under the radar slightly, but he's certainly one of the best player models in the game.

7 Lionel Messi

Inter Miami CF

  • Position: RW/ST/CAM/RM
  • Rating: 88

Though he may not be classed as one of the best players the game has to offer anymore, it's indisputable that Lionel Messi is one of the best footballers to ever kick a ball. With such a high reputation and a strong history in the Fifa franchise, EA knew from the get-go they'd have to get his player model right.

Unsurprisingly, they did just that, as Messi's ability to glide across the pitch has been rendered to near perfection. His face scan is unquestionably iconic, and any player who uses him in-game is bound to be swept up in nostalgia for his domination in titles past.

6 Kylian Mbappé

Real Madrid CF

  • Position: ST/LW
  • Rating: 91

Even though the Real Madrid team is packed full of superstars, if there's one player that is a must for any starting 11 it's Mbappé. His electric pace and unreal shooting make him the highest-rated player in the game, and with such prestige comes an excellent face scan to boot.

Anyone playing Ultimate Team dreams of having him in their team, and for those that have him in their lineup, he's immediately the stand-out star. Even though he'll be a priority for high-quality rendering for years to come, it's unclear how EA can begin to improve for future iterations when he already looks almost picture-perfect.

5 Trent Alexander-Arnold

Liverpool FC

  • Position: RB
  • Rating: 86

There are few players out there with a passing range like Trent Alexander-Arnold, and ever since he came through the Liverpool academy he's been a staple in the first team. Not only that, but he's a well-sought-after player in Ultimate Team too, so EA always ensures that his player model is up to scratch.

This year is no different, and Trent's model is by far one of the most recognizable the game has to offer. All players need to do is look at the player, and they'll know a killer pass is coming their way.

4 Diogo Jota

Liverpool FC

  • Position: ST/LW
  • Rating: 85

As if being in the typical starting 11 for Liverpool FC wasn't enough, Diogo Jota also felt the need to be an excellent gamer. Back in 2021, Jota was ranked as the world's number 1 Fifa 21 player, and ever since then, he's regularly seen grinding Champs on the weekend just like any other EA FC player would.

Luckily for him, if he were to ever select himself for his Ultimate Team, he might mistake the screen for looking in a mirror. EA has done a superb job at recreating his likeness, with the additional blemishes and freckles only adding to the realism.

3 Erling Haaland

Manchester City FC

  • Position: ST
  • Rating: 91

Haaland's taken the Premier League by storm and he's easily one of the best strikers in the world, with many fans claiming he's a robot due to his remarkable athletic capabilities. However, despite the jokes, he is in fact human and EA worked hard to get his resemblance in the game just right.

It's not just his chiseled face and scrunched-up hair that they managed to replicate, as the developers have even simulated his colossal build and powerful running style. If there's a striker running at a player's defense, they'll know immediately that it's the Norwegian powerhouse.

2 Virgil van Dijk

Liverpool FC

  • Position: CB
  • Rating: 89

Any Liverpool fan will tell you that Van Dijk's been the key to their recent success, and it'd be hard to disagree. He's still arguably one of the best center-backs in the world and an icon of world football.

EA has always made a special effort to reflect his imposing figure in-game, and this year they smashed it. He's a titan to come across on the pitch, and his towering figure paired with his defined facial features make him one of the most realistic depictions of a player put to screen.

1 Jude Bellingham

Real Madrid CF

  • Position: CAM/CM
  • Rating: 90

It should perhaps come as no shock that the game's most realistic rendition of a player is their cover star, Jude Bellingham. The model's likeness to the superstar is astounding, and perhaps some of the best ever put to display.

Every angle of his face has been carefully mapped, and the way he plays in-game only adds to the realism that his player exudes. His model is a testament to the visual strength that EA Sports FC 25 can display, and a sign that the immersion these games offer will continue to evolve.

item.title: Dorkly Bits - Megaman Needs To Go
item.description: To be the number 1 robot, you need a place to go number 2.

item.title: Throne and Liberty: All Available Dash Morphs
item.description:
Throne and Liberty has many different ways to traverse the world. While the fastest method is to find Waypoints and fast travel between them, players will still need to traverse the distance between these structures. They can accomplish this by using Morph.

Sometimes they may need to use one of their many Swim Morphs to cross a large body of water, and sometimes they’ll make use of a Glide Morph to soar through the air. However, the largest portion of their time will be spent on foot and in a Dash Morph form.

All Dash Morphs in Throne and Liberty (& How to Get Them)

Morph Name

How to Get

Growth from Obtaining

Ancient Taion

Obtained after defeating Rex Chimaerus. This boss can be found at the Temple of Slaughter.

+15 Growth Points

Fierce Taion

Obtained by clearing the 20th floor of Taedal’s Tower by defeating Revenging Skeleton Commander.

+15 Growth Points

Proud Taion

Obtained through the premium track of the Season 1 Battle Pass of Throne and Liberty.

+3 Growth Points

Saber Taion

This is one of three default Dash Morphs that is available to all players.

+10Growth Points

Radiant Wolf

This Dash Morph will be available for players that purchased the Deluxe or Ultimate versions of the Early Access Packs.

+13 Growth Points

Shadow Lion

This Dash Morph will be available for players that purchased the any version of the Early Access Packs.

+3 Growth Points

Ruffle Diatrima

At first glance, one might think this is one of the game’s Glide Morphs. It can be obtained after completing “Investigate Chief Terror Bird Nest” in the Exploration section of the Codex.

+15 Growth Points

Beak Diatrima

Obtained after defeating Toublek. This boss can be found at Tyrant’s Isle.

+15 Growth Points

Arkhan Diatrima

This Dash Morph can be obtained by purchasing it in the store for 800 Lucent.

+3 Growth Points

Fenrian Skoll

Obtained after defeating the Lycan tribal Chieftain world boss known as Kowzan. You will face off against a different version of this boss depending on the time of day you face it.

+15 Growth Points

Ghost Skoll

Obtained after defeating the world boss known as Chernobog.

+15 Growth Points

Iron Skoll

Obtained after completing the dynamic event known as Lift the Moonlight Spell.

+15 Growth Points

Shadow Skoll

Obtained after completing “At Henry's Grave” in the Adventure section of the Codex.

+15 Growth Points

Wild Skoll

This is one of three default Dash Morphs that is available to all players.

+10 Growth Points

Lightning Purpuma

This Dash Morph can be obtained by purchasing it in the store for 800 Lucent.

+3 Growth Points

Shadow Purpuma

This is one of three default Dash Morphs that is available to all players.

+10 Growth Points

Fluffy Almiraz

Many players are wondering how to obtain this Morph. There is no information provided in game about it, so it is likely a Morph that players will be able to obtain at a later time — or be available as some form of external reward they redeem.

+3 Growth Points

Dash Morph Growth Point Rewards in Throne and Liberty

Players will gain Growth Points for their Dash Morph category each time they get a new Dash Morph. They can see how many more points they need by looking in the top right of this category. Each time they hit a milestone, they will unlock cumulative bonuses when they use their equipped Dash Morph. Below is a list of these bonuses.

  • Dash Morph Acceleration Bonus +35% ( Level 1 )
  • Dashing Acceleration Stamina Cost Efficiency Up +10% ( Level 2 )
  • Dash Morph Acceleration Bonus +10% ( Level 3 )
  • Dashing Acceleration Stamina Cost Efficiency Up +5% ( Level 4 )
  • Dash Morph Acceleration Bonus +10% ( Level 5 )

Future Dash Morphs For Throne and Liberty

Players can get hyped over the fact there are plenty of unavailable Dash Morphs outside that of the Global Release version of the game and that these will likely be making their way to global servers in due time. Players can also expect new Morphs to come with in-game events and through the game's Battle Pass , with some being able to be obtained as Twitch Drops. Collecting these future Morphs will help push their Growth Rate up so they can make the most out of traveling through Dash Morphs.

item.title: Every Fortnitemares 2024 Leak Explained
item.description:
Fortnite 's Absolute Doom has easily been the most content-heavy season of Chapter 5. The season has brought players a plethora of Marvel collaborations, mythic items, the Day of Doom LTM, and a quest storyline that will soon culminate with an in-game event on Saturday, October 5 at 2 PM ET. Though the ongoing Marvel season won't technically end until November 2, Fortnite will start shifting its focus away from Doctor Doom this month as the game unleashes its annual Fortnitemares celebration.

Fortnitemares is Fortnite 's yearly Halloween update and brings with it new gameplay items, seasonal map decorations, the Horde Rush mode, and spooky crossover cosmetics. Previous Fortnitemares events have seen characters like Frankenstein's Monster, Ash Williams, and Jack Skellington board the battle bus. While Epic has yet to officially confirm the contents of this October's update, a recent leak showcased some surprising collaborations, a revamped location for Battle Royale, and more.

What to Expect From Fortnitemares 2024

A new update on October 1 added several files to the game in preparation for Fortnitemares. Leakers investigated as soon as the update launched and quickly revealed the files' contents. The most noticeable leak came in the form of a new piece of key art via iFireMonkey on X. The art shows off seven unreleased skins, including three new crossover skins.

Every New Fortnite Crossover Skin

In the past, Fortnite has added plenty of skins from R-rated franchises like the Xenomorph, the Predator, and the Terminator. However, last year's Fortnitemares saw the game add its first serial killer skin with Michael Myers from the Halloween series. Evidently, that skin did well, as Fortnite will supposedly collaborate with Saw and The Texas Chainsaw Massacre next.

Leaks claim both franchises will have at least one skin in the new update: Billy the Puppet for Saw and Leatherface for The Texas Chainsaw Massacre . The characters' inclusions are quite a shock given Fortnite 's family-friendly image — Leatherface is literally wearing the skin of one of his victims, after all — but it's exciting news for horror fans nonetheless. Leatherface also looks to have a harvesting tool in the form of his iconic chainsaw, but it's unknown if this can be purchased separately or only in a bundle with Leatherface himself. Outside the realm of horror, a new Halloween-themed Marshmello skin can be seen in the leaked key art too. Given the popularity of the original Marshmello Fortnite concert, Fortnite's double-dipping with the DJ makes perfect sense.

Three other crossover skins will likely appear in Fortnite this October. According to several posts from iFireMonkey, a second batch of The Nightmare Before Christmas skins is coming and will include Sally and a Pumpkin King variant of Jack Skellington. A new Marvel skin for Mephisto should also be coming soon. In addition to leaks, this fiendish villain has been teased by Epic through the recent Ghost Ri-Durrr skin's loading screen and in the forge at Castle Doom.

Every New Original Skin

This year's Fortnitemares still has some spooky takes on the game's original skins for players uninterested in the aforementioned collaborations. Knightmare, Pumpkin Knight, Phantom Guff, and what looks to be a witch version of the Princess Lexa Fortnite Crew skin are all shown off in the key art. Other skins like Shadow Monks and Dark Ruby were found in the game's files as well.

Every New Sandbox Change

Besides purchasable cosmetics, the Battle Royale map will be getting its usual Halloween makeover. As can be seen in the leaked key art, Mount Olympus will soon be overtaken by vines and massive pumpkins. Mount Olympus felt bland to many after the Zeus mythics and NPC were removed at the end of Chapter 5 Season 2, so this refresh could incentivize players to explore the Northeast quarter of the island.

When it comes to the loot pool, the wood stake shotgun, pumpkin launcher, and witch broom are all returning this year. The leaker HYPEX stated in a post on X that a Saw -based mythic can also be obtained by players. The item is called "Boom Billy" and will be a deployable version of Billy the Puppet on his iconic tricycle. The puppet will follow an enemy player, ask them if they "want to play a game," and then explode when within a certain vicinity of the enemy.

Even if these leaks have uncovered all that there is to know about the upcoming Fortnitemares, it looks like players will have plenty to check out in the game this October. Many fans complained about 2023's Fortnitemares update due to its focus on cosmetics rather than playable content. While this year will still be adding quite a few items to the in-game store, the return of Horde Rush in conjunction with the Battle Royale changes should hopefully make this Fortnitemares an improvement over last year's event. Fortnitemares will begin on October 15 according to leakers.
